metadata.title: CVE-2023-0179 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - high
metadata.description:
A buffer overflow vulnerability was found in the Netfilter subsystem in theLinux Kernel. This issue could allow the leakage of both stack and heapaddresses, and potentially allow Local Privilege Escalation to the rootuser via arbitrary code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0179` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-5.4.0-9-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-generic - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-lowlatency - 5.4.0-9.12
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-9-snapdragon - 5.4.0-9.12
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-67-generic - 5.15.0-67.74~20.04.1
